articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The tanker is reportedly linked to Israel, and the strike follows Houthi attacks on Red Sea ships.
articles.title: India drone strike: Cargo ship attacked off Gujarat coast

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The US wants Israel to scale back its offensive in Gaza - the next few weeks will be crucial in testing its influence.
articles.title: Stakes are immense as Biden presses Israel to change course

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: An Alabama woman gives birth to a pair of girls after a "one-in-a-million" dicavitary pregnancy.
articles.title: Alabama: Mother with rare double womb gives birth to two babies in two days

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: One gallery owner has told the BBC he believes the artwork could be worth up to £500,000.
articles.title: Banksy: Council calls in police to find Peckham art worth up to £500,000

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: An overnight air strike reportedly kills 18 in one refugee camp while another is told to evacuate.
articles.title: Israel pounds Gaza as UN calls for more aid

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The former member of the US country music band dies after being involved in a two-vehicle crash in Texas.
articles.title: Dixie Chicks band founding member Laura Lynch dies in car crash

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Zhu Ling, 50, was poisoned with the highly toxic thallium in 1994 but no-one was ever convicted.
articles.title: Zhu Ling: Woman dies decades after unsolved China poisoning

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A muted Christmas celebration sees worshippers lighting candles and praying for peace in Manger Square.
articles.title: Bethlehem nativity scene depicted with rubble and razor wire

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A former TV journalist is barred from standing by officials due to "mistakes" on her application form.
articles.title: Russia bans anti-war candidate from challenging Putin

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Flags fly at half-mast on a day of national mourning after 14 people were killed in Prague on Thursday.
articles.title: Czech Republic mourns victims of Prague university mass shooting
